publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-37# Elaine Murray: Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries—That the Parliament applauds the success of the community warden scheme in north-west Dumfries in tackling antisocial behaviour, promoting alternative activities for young people and working with the police to improve safety in the local community; welcomes the extension of the scheme into other parts of Dumfries and Galloway, such as Annan, and believes that the Scottish Executive should consider making further funding available to enable local authorities to increase the numbers of community wardens working in their communities.
S3M-37# Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries (lodged on 22 May 2007) Bill Butler*, Mary Mulligan*, Jackie Baillie*, Trish Godman*

S3M-37# Elaine Murray: Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries—That the Parliament applauds the success of the community warden scheme in north-west Dumfries in tackling antisocial behaviour, promoting alternative activities for young people and working with the police to improve safety in the local community; welcomes the extension of the scheme into other parts of Dumfries and Galloway, such as Annan, and believes that the Scottish Executive should consider making further funding available to enable local authorities to increase the numbers of community wardens working in their communities. Supported by: Bill Butler, Mary Mulligan, Jackie Baillie, Trish Godman, Des McNulty*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Helen Eadie*, Elaine Smith*, Hugh Henry* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-37# Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries (lodged on 22 May 2007) Robin Harper*
S3M-37# Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries (lodged on 22 May 2007) Cathy Jamieson*
S3M-37# Success of Community Warden Scheme in North West Dumfries (lodged on 22 May 2007) Michael McMahon*
